discourse_list.title: Port Oasis Trade to xDAI Network?

content.content: Hello, The Oasis Trade app (https://oasis.app/) is one of (if not the one) most advanced trading apps on Ethereum supporting limit orders. It was an amazing smart-contract achievement for the time: many people bought their first MKR tokens in Oasis, me included. Currently, however, Oasis Trade seem to suffer the very high Ethereum fees. For example, there is a spread of about 5% on the DAI/WETH pairs: https://oasis.app/trade/market/WETH/DAI To address this problem, it might make sense to launch OasisDEX on a L2 chain. QUESTION 1: there is this emerging L2 chain called xDAI (https://www.xdaichain.com/). The fees are currently negligible, and they will stay low thanks to PoA. Would it be possible to officially port OasisTrade on xDAI? QUESTION 2: Of course this will require some support/resources from the Fundation. If these are not directly available, could the Fundation quote us a figure (price)? The MakerDAO might use the returns of the SF to pay for it (if the community votes on this, of course). QUESTION 3: Perhaps we could introduce some fees on the trades, so this could generate revenues for MakerDAO too? If there is enough interest, I could try to run a poll on this topic. But first let’s see what is the response in this thread.
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is proposing to launch OasisDEX on a L2 chain to address the high Ethereum fees. They suggest using xDAI and ask if it would be possible to officially port OasisTrade on xDAI. They also ask if the MakerDAO Foundation could provide support/resources and quote a figure for the project. Finally, they suggest introducing fees on trades to generate revenue for MakerDAO and ask for feedback on the proposal.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: A number of people have been suggesting xDAI lately and it sounds great in theory. I’d really like to know more about who is on the POA list though, how incentivised they are to keep the chain running, and how much of a risk it is to rely on the xDAI security rather than the L1 security of Ethereum.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party asking questions about proposal
3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: @LongForWisdom yes there is some kind of excitement around xDAI, it would appear. Regarding the PoA validators, here is the list: https://www.xdaichain.com/about-xdai/news-and-information/current-xdai-validators As you (i.e., generic reader) can see, it includes MakerDAO. So we are kind of already have a foot in the game. In any case the technical aspects of xDAI can be perhaps better discussed in a specialised thread? One important point: it seems to me like launching officially OasisTrade on xDAI would not generate direct negative risks to MKR-holders, DAI-peg, or anything like that. The only ‘players’ taking risks are are the traders, but that is true for almost all activities in crypto. We will definitely need to add a big disclaimer somewhere. But, again, that is pretty much standard in Crypto.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: I think Loopring and Uniswap are working on L2 limit order trading and AMM. I don’t think we have a chance against them considering our development speed and governance/funding.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party extending to proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: Would probably need to expand on the Validator list–most will say that it’s Centralized. But ya, this is worth exploring. I would prefer if the Community works on this versus the Maker Foundation Devs, as they are already overwhelmed with work.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

3rd party auditing and reviewing proposal
None of the topics listed match
None of the topics listed match

content.content: Yes, my observation is that Maker devs have produced a very advanced (still state-of-the-art) smart contract, Oasis Trade, and it’s a bit of a shame that it is now rendered obsolete by high TX fees. Porting it to L2 might bring new life to it, and possibly some revenues. It’s true that maybe Uniswap is working on “L2 limit order trading” but:  that is Soon™, vs Working Now and Tested a lot. even if Soon™ actually comes soon, it’s not obvious that it will be better than what we already have. In general it’s good practice to keep value in what you have, and it would be a shame to just forget about Oasis Trade. There would be good marketing for MakerDao in having the first limit-order DEX exchange on L2.  I agree with  I would prefer if the Community works on this versus the Maker Foundation Devs, as they are already overwhelmed with work.  but how can we proceed concretely?
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: We would need to create a working group–there are grants available for such–I know @befitsandpiper has been working on xDAI–but not sure if he has time to fit this in as well. But ya, a working group is a way that  Community Members get set this off, imo.

content.content: Thanks @flipflopflapdelegate! Perfect, let’s wait here to see if a reasonable number of people is interested in this. If that’s the case, I will try to spend some time to set up a Working Group.

content.content: It’s too early to speculate (at least for majority of community members) who will win layer-2 solutions. I would like to hear first from people who understand L2 tech and also have enough inside info and knowledge about various projects. My suspicion is that uniswap v3 will easily win AMM, not sure about order book exchanges.

content.content: Trying to get people who would be willing to be a part of working groups over here. Some people have expressed interest but there haven’t been any meetings yet, and I’m spread a little thin for setting up these proposals. I made a meta-raid document the other day to try to get some traction over at raid guild. They are also very pumped about xdai. Here’s the doc:    hackmd.io    Maker Raid - HackMD

content.content: Definitely. That’s an exciting project with easy onboarding for users (simple change in Metamask), fact, low fees, and some growth hacks (BrightID, honey faucet). However I see little rationality in that excitement and I feel like interesting questions sometimes get ignored (?). Most of the credibility I give to the project - other than consensual excitement - is the presence of MakerDAO and Gnosis in the list of validators which admittedly is relatively poor, but probably the case for other folks. Thus, I prefer to turn on my “be careful” mode. As we are on MakerDAO forum, can anyone explain what role MakerDAO plays as a validators, on what server this/those validator(s) is (are) running (and which individual manages it), and any history on the onboarding of MakerDAO in this project ? It would be valuable information for me.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party asking questions about proposal
3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party extending to proposal
3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: there are upgrades planned including public staking for validation which should be released… anytime now… the chain essentially becomes a DPOS chain then. There’s also optimistic bridging which is a work in progress, and gets rid of trust issues for the bridges, since they can be overriden through a mainnet transaction. I agree that it pays to be cautious rn, but also I do think the xdai team is doing good things, and they are thinking about ways to fix these concerns as best as they can as soon as possible. xdai will never be as secure and decentralized as mainnet. But it may be good enough for the majority of small players in this space.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: In my opinion the topic here is not really if xDAI is going to with the L2 race or not. We could port Oasis Trade to xDai and other L2 platforms. It all depends on the cost/benefits ratio. The good point about xDai is that it’s running now, and pretty well: in my little experiments I managed to:  use the faucet to get free HONEY use Honeyswap for a swap provide liquidity to Honeyswap Vote in 1hive using the HONEY token  and all of this with 0.1gwei (~0.0001DAI in transaction fees) fast transactions. I am sure there is still a lot to do to improve security/decentralisation/etc, but it’s running now. And if the cost to port Oasis Trade is not very large, I think it might be a good investment for MakerDAO.
